content.description:
The Route to Nowhere 5.11c/d, 2 pitches, 200’. This route lies 100’ left of the Estwing Arete on a 200’ high wall. Look for bolts starting about 20’ up the wall.

Pitch 1: 5.11c, 120’.

Pitch 2: 5.11d, 80’.

Gear: Standard rack.

Descent: Rappel the route.

FA: Eric Salmi 2010.
content.location: 100' left of the unmistakable Estwing Arete.

climbs.name: The Estwing Arete
climbs.fa: Eric Salmi, Craig Martin, Tyler Phillips, Julia Salmi 2008                                                              FFA: Eric Salmi

content.description:
Established in 2008 in ground-up style with no bolts. Although the experience was very satisfying, the end product was a poorly protected route that none of us wanted to climb again. Subsequent ascents have seen the addition of several lead bolts as well as anchor bolts making for a fun and well protected climb in a very exposed position. It is often windy in this area.

Pitch 1

: Begin off a boulder at the base of the route. Climb up and left following 3 bolts and into a right facing corner. Climb this corner up to a small roof and hand traverse to the right back to the arête. Jam up the short but wildly exposed hand and fist crack to a small belay ledge with a 2 bolt anchor. 5.10-, 80'.

Pitch 2:

Climb up the hand crack in the steep corner system to the right of the belay. At the top of this corner make some moves to the left and gain a large ledge system. Ramble up the ledges to their highest point and locate a bolt on the wall above. Climb up passing a roof on its right side and negotiate some easy climbing on less than stellar rock. Belay on a large ledge. 5.10-, 100'.

Pitch 3

: Gain the obvious ledge by climbing past 2 fixed pins, ascend the headwall via the right most crack system leading to the summit. Pumpy and exposed climbing with a bit of grittiness. 5.11-, 90.

Rappel the route or climb one more crappy pitch and walk off down the Hayden Couloir.
content.protection:
Single rack to a #4 Camalot, Doubles in the #.5 - #2 Camalot range.

60 Meter rope. Helmets.
content.location:
Hayden Peak. Right hand arete of

The Estwing Crag

.
